intro: Micranthes ferruginea, commonly known as the rustweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine, rusty-colored hairs, giving it its common name. The small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the summer months.
